title: Billie Eilish to be reunited with missing ring after claiming it was stolen
text:
Billie Eilish could soon be reunited with the ring she claimed was stolen during a recent live show, because it was handed in to security staff.

American singer Billie lost the ring while performing at the Austin City Limits Festival in October during one of several forays into the audience, where she hugged, kissed and shook hands with fans.

But after returning to the stage the 17-year old noticed the accessory was missing, prompting her to announce: ‘Somebody stole my f***ing ring!’

Good news: Billie Eilish could soon be reunited with the ring she claimed was stolen during a recent live show, because it was handed in to security staff

With the announcement prompting chants of ‘give it back’ from the thousands of fans who attended the event at Austin’s Zilker Metropolitan Park, Billie moved to calm the situation by admitting it was her fault.

'The ring is gone for good,' she conceded. 'It’s okay don’t worry about it. Whoever has that s**t though take care of it, okay.'

However the singer is set to have the ring returned to her after it was retrieved from the ground by a fan at the annual event.

Worth: The ring (pictured) is understood to be inexpensive costume jewelry from chain store Adina, retailing at less than $100

Missing: American singer Billie lost the ring while performing at the Austin City Limits Festival in October during one of several forays into the audience (pictured onstage at the event)

A video circulating online shows a fan signalling to security guards and pointing to the ground after meeting Billie, telling them: 'My ring fell off when I shook her hand.'

The concert-goer has since told TMZ that while she lied about owning the ring, she only took a picture of it before handing the object in to a staff member.

According to the website the ring is inexpensive costume jewelry from chain store Adina, retailing at less than $100.

Not happy: After returning to the stage the 17-year old noticed the accessory was missing, prompting her to announce, ‘Somebody stole my f***ing ring!’

The incident comes after Billie revealed that she's the 'happiest' she has ever been and is finally embracing - even loving - her meteoric fame.

'I'm finally not miserable,' she told Elle. 'Two years ago, I felt like nothing mattered; every single thing was pointless.

'Not just in my life, but everything in the whole world. I was fully clinically depressed. It's insane to look back and not be anymore.'
description: American singer Billie lost the ring while performing at the Austin City Limits Festival in October during one of several forays into the audience, where she hugged, kissed and shook hands with fans.
